column1: The Purple Pig////Because we had heard such good things about this place
column2: we wanted to try a lot of the different options. We went for broke trying to explore the menu. We started with the crispy pig ears. This dish was fine
column3: but came with completely too many pickled peppers
column4: and it kind of ruined it for me. The fried deviled egg was disappointing -- one egg that didn't have complex flavors for $8... Â (Apparently
column5: The Purple Pig really likes their pickled vegetables
column6: because this dish was full of cornishes
column7: which again ruin this dish for me. I'm fine with some pickling agent on a dish
column8: but they over do it here.) The roasted beets and goat cheese foam was absolutely delicious
column9: and one of my favorite dishes that we had.
